Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery stand; exterior: whitish slip; above, two wide bands; below, black-figure decoration consisting of cocks (of both, only tail feathers with alternating added red and added white feathers remaining) standing back to back; lotus buds as filling ornament above the cocks.
Curator's comments: According to Cook, the cocks are typologically earlier than those normal in Clazomenian black figure. For similar long tail feathers, see British Museum 1900,0214.2. E.R. Price (East Greek Pottery, 1927, 22) argued that white slip Clazomenian pottery was the link between the Clazomenian sarcophagi, which were covered in a white slip, and the later Clazomenian black figure wares. She explained that the features (the use of white dots as well as the use of white lines together with incised lines for inner details) on the white slip sherds are paralleled either the sarcophagi or the later vases. Cook (1952 note 64) rejected that argument on the basis of both dating and styles. The sherds listed by Price in her arguement and tentatively identified by Cook as British Museum 1888,0601.575 and possibly Oxford AN1896-1908-G.130.10. A third sherd was mentioned by Price and described as having a cock as decoration. Cook subsequently incorrectly identified the sherd as 1886,0401.1197 which is an Attic Black Figure column krater. His CVA reference is also incorrect because CVA British Museum VIII, pl. 589, no. 9 discusses a Milesian Fikellura amphora. This sherd first mentioned by Price is most likely British Museum 1886,0401.1147 which is a North Ionian black figure stand with the tail feathers of two cocks. In all three cases, the styles are different, the dates do not match and 1888,0601.575 and 1886,0401.1147 are North Ionian without specification.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.20)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.863) (phase 3)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 23, no. 9, pl. 8) (Incorrectly labelled 1886,0401.1197)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 139 note 64)
